item.title: 5 Reasons You Should Book A Room At Poetry Inn In The Napa Valley Now!
item.description:
5 Reasons You Should Book A Room At Poetry Inn In The Napa Valley Now!

Canadians brought us basketball, poutine and IMAX, but possibly the best thing a Canadian has brought to the Napa Valley is Poetry Inn in the Stags Leap district. Cliff Lede (pronounced lay-dee), a Canadian construction magnate, opened this Howard Backen-designed gem, hidden high atop the valley floor on a hillside cabernet sauvignon vineyard, in 2005-three years after he founded his namesake winery right down the hill in Yountville.

Taking out the Laundry If you have a few extra dollars sitting around and need a celebrity kitchen, Thomas Keller is selling his French Laundry's temporary kitchen made of four shipping containers that add up to 1,120 square feet. item.title: Charity auction raises $160,000
item.description:
Charity auction raises $160,000

The Valley Fire Relief Charity Wine Auction, held Sunday at the Culinary Institute of America at Greystone, brought in more than $160,000 for the victims of last September's Valley Fire. About a hundred people attended the event, held in the second-story Barrel Room of the Greystone Cellars.
